title: McDonald's is shutting down its Russian restaurants
description: Western companies across multiple industries are halting operations in Russia after the country's attack on Ukraine.

title: The little airport on the top of the world
description: Against the snow-frosted backdrop of Alaska's Chugach Mountains, serving a city of just 300,000 people, sits what might just be the best-located airport in the world today.

title: Lululemon will soon sell women's running shoes for $148
description: Lululemon unveiled a new product Tuesday that speaks to the upscale brand's ambition to expand into new categories.

title: US spy chiefs offer most public assessment of Putin's motivations to Congress
Frantic rush to leave Sumy via evacuation corridor after deadly nighttime airstrikes
description: A tense and fleeting evacuation from Ukraine's northeastern city of Sumy took place on Tuesday after Russian airstrikes killed 21 people, including two children, the night before, Ukrainian authorities said.

title: Anxiety and uncertainty grow after basketball star Brittney Griner's arrest in Russia
description: The arrest of two-time US Olympic basketball gold medalist Brittney Griner has left supporters anxious about her well-being and fearful that she might become a political pawn.

title: Aaron Rodgers agrees to stay with Green Bay Packers, Pat McAfee says
description: National Football League quarterback Aaron Rodgers has reportedly agreed to remain with the Green Bay Packers.

title: Apple unveils first budget 5G iPhone
description: At its first product event of the year on Tuesday, Apple unveiled an upgraded iPad Air, a new desktop computer and a powerful new Mac chip. But the standout product was a new budget iPhone with access to 5G networks.

title: 'SNL' star Kate McKinnon mocks controversial 'Don't Say Gay' bill
description: 'Saturday Night Live' star Kate McKinnon, who is openly gay, mocked Florida's controversial 'Don't Say Gay' bill. The legislation would ban gender identity or sexual orientation discussions in K-3 classrooms.

title: The West closes in on Russia's last lifeline
description: The United States and Europe have pummeled Russia with unprecedented sanctions over the past several weeks as Vladimir Putin's army bears down on Ukraine. But the West has largely left Russia's largest export untouched: energy.

title: Oldest-known octopus relative lived 328 million years ago and had 10 arms
description: The oldest ancestor of modern octopuses lived 328 million years ago and had 10 arms, according to a new study. Researchers have named the previously unknown species after US President Joe Biden.

title: Jury finds first US Capitol riot defendant to go on trial guilty on all counts
Ukraine claims Russian general has been killed in Kharkiv
description: The Ukrainian defense ministry has claimed that a Russian general was killed in battle near Ukraine's second-largest city, Kharkiv.

title: Better, after firing 900 employees over Zoom, is laying off 3,000 more workers
description: Better.com, the embattled online mortgage company, announced Tuesday that it's taking the "difficult step of streamlining" its operations and laying off about one-third of its workforce, amounting to roughly 3,000 jobs.

title: Prosecutors ask for juror in Ghislaine Maxwell trial to be granted immunity ahead of questioning over whether he lied on jury form
description: Federal prosecutors have formally asked a judge to grant immunity to a juror in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial before he is questioned in court Tuesday morning over whether he lied on a jury questionnaire form, according to a court filing.

title: Xi says China willing to mediate in Ukraine but reiterates opposition to West's sanctions
Republicans prove they are their own worst enemy in 2022
California woman's alleged fake abduction cost the public hundreds of thousands of dollars, authorities say
description: A California woman's abduction claim, which federal prosecutors allege was false, cost the public hundreds of thousands of dollars, according to statements from authorities and court documents.

title: Xi says China is willing to mediate in Ukraine
description: • Taiwan warily watches China

title: How adults can make friends now
description: Forming new friendships is important for mental well-being, my husband recently told me. He's a therapist and shared this advice during a podcast with me about weathering pandemic stress and uncertainty.

title: 'The Thing About Pam' dresses up Renée Zellweger for an odd 'Dateline' drama
description: Drama meets "Dateline" in "The Thing About Pam," an NBC series that seeks to turn one of the newsmagazine's salacious stories into a limited series, complete with ghoulish narration by reporter Keith Morrison. Featuring Renée Zellweger tromping around under the weight of prosthetic makeup, it's a true-crime experiment that clearly wants to be the next "Fargo" and doesn't get there.

title: This is what a nation run by women looks like
Cybersecurity firm says Chinese hackers breached six US state agencies
description: A Chinese government-backed hacking group has breached local government agencies in at least six US states in the last 10 months as part of a persistent information-gathering operation, investigators at cybersecurity firm Mandiant said Tuesday.

title: Joining a company remotely? Here's how to bond with your colleagues
description: Getting to know new colleagues through a box on your screen while working from home can have its challenges.

title: Google is buying cybersecurity firm Mandiant for $5.4 billion
description: Google on Tuesday announced it has agreed to buy cybersecurity firm Mandiant for around $5.4 billion, one of the largest acquisitions in the tech giant's history and a big bet that helping companies better address cyber threats can bolster its cloud computing business.

title: Venomous Jorō spiders predicted to spread across US east coast -- but there's no need to panic
description: The itsy-bitsy spider climbed up the waterspout ... and all across the East Coast.

title: How this letter became a symbol of support for Russia's invasion
description: The letter "Z" has been a symbol of Russian support in their invasion of Ukraine. But what does it stand for? CNN's Phil Black discusses.

title: Fastest growing refugee crisis since WWII arrives in Moldova
description: CNN's Ivan Watson reports on Ukrainians who are fleeing by the thousands to the tiny former Soviet Republic of Moldova.

title: Zelensky's heroism is coming up against Western red lines
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is like the West's moral conscience, with his daily video commentary highlighting his country's heroism in resisting a Russian invasion that has degenerated into murderous barrages against civilians.

title: How Russia's war could knock out Europe's economy
description: Stagflation strikes fear into the hearts of economists — and policymakers —the world over. Europe could be headed for something even worse.

title: Ukrainian man cries out to his wife as she flees to safety
description: CNN's Clarissa Ward reports from Kyiv Central Station, where Ukrainians attempting to escape the country face large crowds as Russian forces hit closer to the capital.

title: Atlanta Falcons' Calvin Ridley suspended indefinitely for gambling on NFL games
description: Atlanta Falcons wide receiver Calvin Ridley has been suspended indefinitely for gambling on NFL games during the 2021 season, the league announced Monday.

title: Alexander Zverev handed eight-week suspended ban but can play at Indian Wells
description: Alexander Zverev will be allowed to play at Indian Wells, after receiving a suspended eight-week ban for his behavior at the Mexican Open in February.

title: Ukrainian Paralympians' thoughts with those fighting invasion as they enjoy golden success
description: Ukraine secured a clean sweep of medals in two more Para biathlon events at the 2022 Winter Paralympics in Beijing on Tuesday.

title: Zelensky's unorthodox path to inspiring Ukrainians during war
description: CNN's Phil Black reports on Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's rise from comedic actor to "improbable wartime leader."

title: Wordle and your brain: Does playing make you smarter?
description: Wordle-bragging, arguably one of the newest forms of humble-bragging, has taken over social media. Solving the five-letter daily puzzle, and doing it in only three, two or even your first attempt (!) is a badge of pride for many.

title: Paris to build $145m cable car system
description: Paris is already home to some of the most popular attractions in the world, and the French capital could be about to get its very first urban cable car.

title: 'Go home!': Gunfire rings out as protesters confront Russian military
description: Video from Chaplynka, Ukraine, shows protesters shouting at Russian soldiers. There have been no reports of injuries so far.

title: Shane Warne died of 'natural causes,' authorities say, as children recall 'best dad anyone could ask for'
description: Shane Warne died of natural causes, Thai police said on Monday after releasing details of an autopsy on the Australian cricket great.

title: Supermodel Gigi Hadid to donate fashion week earnings to Ukraine relief
description: Supermodel Gigi Hadid has announced that she will donate all her fashion month earnings towards relief efforts in Ukraine.

title: Museums race against time to save Ukraine's cultural treasures
description: The walls of Lviv's National Museum stand bare. Elaborate gold lacquered panels, on display after being recovered from 17th century Baroque churches, have been bundled up and hidden in the basement in a race to save the city's cultural treasures from possible Russian attack.

title: Volunteers in Ukraine are doing this to help combat Russian forces
description: Women in Ukraine are volunteering to prepare care packages for soldiers on the front lines combating the Russian invasion. CNN's Anderson Cooper reports.

title: South Korea's next president: Day one challenges
description: South Korea's presidential election is just one day away. Whoever wins will have to deal with threats from North Korea, rising tensions between the US and China, and lead South Korea through the next stage of the pandemic. CNN's Paula Hancocks takes an in-depth look at the two leading candidates vying for the presidency.

title: A second band says Dua Lipa copied their song. Listen for yourself
description: The 26-year-old singer, Dua Lipa, is facing a second copyright lawsuit just days after another band accused her 2020 smash hit "Levitating" of "copying" their song.
